direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve creating a new Document instance with a specified base URI, and they share similar initialization steps.
Both methods involve adding elements to a Document, although createShell adds a specific structure (html, head, body) while appendElement can add any element.
Both methods interact with the Document's HTML structure, with createShell creating a basic structure and htmlEl ensuring the existence of the root HTML element.
Both methods involve accessing or creating the head element of the Document, although createShell does it as part of its initialization.
Both methods involve accessing or creating the body element of the Document, although createShell does it as part of its initialization.
